content: Paper titled Best Arm Identification in Restless Markov Multi-Armed Bandits accepted for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Information Theory. Based on joint work with colleague Kota Srinivas Reddy and postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan.

Paper titled Almost Cost-Free Communication in Federated Best Arm Identification accepted for presentation at the 37th AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI). This is joint work with colleague Kota Srinivas Reddy and postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan.
Presented the paper titled Best Restless Markov Arm Identification at the 2022 IEEE Information Theory Workshop (ITW), Mumbai, India.
Posted a paper on Federated Best Arm Identification with Heterogeneous Clients. Joint work with Chen Zhirui, postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan, and Prof. Yeow Meng Chee.
Posted a paper on Almost Cost-Free Communication in Federated Best Arm Identification. Joint work with colleague Kota Srinivas Reddy and postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan.

My paper with colleague Kota Srinivas Reddy and postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan, titled Best Restless Markov Arm Identification, accepted for presentation at the IEEE Information Theory Workshop 2022 (to be held in Nov 2022 at the Indian Institute of Technology, Mumbai).
Posted a paper on Best Arm Identification in Restless Markov Multi-Armed Bandits. Joint work with colleague Kota Srinivas Reddy and postdoc supervisor Prof. Vincent Y. F. Tan.
Joined the Institute of Data Science of the National University of Singapore as a Research Fellow.
Won the first place under the Electronics and Communication Engineering category in the 100 seconds competition organised by INAE Kanpur Chapter.
Successfully defended my Ph.D. thesis titled Sequential Controlled Sensing to Detect an Anomalous Process.
Accepted to the Institute of Data Science, National University of Singapore, as a Research Fellow.
My paper with Prof. Rajesh Sundaresan, titled Learning to Detect an Odd Restless Markov Arm, accepted for presentation at the 2021 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory.
My paper with Prof. Rajesh Sundaresan, titled Detecting an Odd Restless Arm with a Trembling Hand, accepted for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Information Theory.
New blog post on Sir C. V. Ramanâ€™s sense of time.
My paper with Prof. Rajesh Sundaresan, titled Learning to Detect an Odd Markov Arm, published in the July issue of the IEEE Transactions on Information Theory.
Video and slides of the virtual presentation for the 2020 IEEE Interational Symposium on Information Theory now up on the website.
